text: Two cis - acting elements GM-kappa B/GC-box and CLE0 , of the <extra_id_0> granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene are required for maximal induction in Jurkat T cells by costimulation with phorbol-12-myristate acetate ( PMA ) and Ca2+ ionophore ( A23187 ) .

text: The GM-kappa B sequence is recognized by NF-kappa B , which is mainly induced by PMA .
The CLE0 sequence interacts with factors , related to a PMA - induced AP-1 and a PMA / A23187 - induced NF-AT .
We examined whether signal transducing components in T cells can activate transcription of the <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

text: Cotransfection of NF-kappa B ( <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - or AP-1 ( <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - expression vectors into Jurkat cells with a luciferase reporter containing the <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter did not stimulate transcription from the <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

text: In contrast , cotransfection with a combination of NF-kappa B and AP-1 significantly augmented transcription from the <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter containing the GM-kappa B / GC-box and the CLE0 ( AP-1 / NF - AT ) .

Expression of a constitutively active calcineurin ( CN ) , a <extra_id_0> Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein phosphatase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , potentiated by two fold the transcriptional activation by NF-kappa B / AP-1 .
Both constitutively active forms of CN and protein kinase C ( PKC ) synergistically activated transcription from the <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

These results suggest that cooperation among NF-kappa B - , AP-1 - and NF-AT - binding sequences is required for induction of the <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene through PKC - and Ca2+ - signaling pathways downstream of T cell activation .
